head_office_address: Masters, Scholars of the University of Cambridge Institute of Astronomy Madingley road
eu_initiatives: We develop reports to justify the value of EC support to our community and the impact of our community on EC goals, particularly scientific research and technological leadership. We also assess the importance of further developing the astronomical community across all of Europe. We also analyse the wider value to society of basic research in astronomy.
organisation_name: Optical Infrared coordination network for astronomy (OPTICON)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership: European Southern Observatory (ESO) is a partner member of OPTICON. It is an international organisation with 15 member states.
goals__remit: Our remit is to coordinate the European Optical Infrared Astronomical community in its interactions with EC funding opportunities. We also manage and implement such funding to strengthen the technological base and the community itself.
relevant_communication: We develop strategy assessments, we run workshops and meetings. We commission reports for submission to our national agency partners and to the EC. We run schools, develop factsheets and a website.
